intro: Cheesemania stellata, commonly known as the star cheese plant, is a unique species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking star-shaped flowers, which are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and it produces small, edible fruits that are sometimes used in local cuisines. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branching. Cheesemania stellata thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sunlight to flourish.
